$description: Core font family primitives defining the typographic voice of the design system. Font stacks include fallbacks for system fonts to ensure consistent rendering across platforms. Public Sans is the primary UI font, Atkinson Hyperlegible Next is used for display/headings for improved accessibility.

body.$description: Primary body font stack. Use for: all body text, UI labels, form inputs, general content. Public Sans is a neutral, open-source typeface optimized for UI and web. Fallbacks: Helvetica Neue (macOS), Helvetica (older Mac), Arial (Windows/Linux), system sans-serif. LOADING: Include weights 400, 500, 600, 700 for full design system support.

heading.$value: 'Atkinson Hyperlegible Next', 'Atkinson Hyperlegible', 'Public Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif
heading.$description: Heading/display font stack optimized for accessibility. Atkinson Hyperlegible Next (by Braille Institute) is designed for maximum legibility, especially for users with low vision. Use for: page titles, section headings, hero text, marketing content. Distinct letterforms reduce character confusion. Falls back to Public Sans for consistency.

mono.$value: ui-monospace, SFMono-Regular, Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, 'Liberation Mono', 'Courier New', monospace
mono.$description: Monospace font stack for code and technical content. Use for: code blocks, inline code, terminal output, data tables with alignment needs, API references. ui-monospace uses system default (SF Mono on Mac, Cascadia on Windows 11). Fallbacks cover all major platforms. All characters have equal width for alignment.
